narratives.question_text: If a requirement, did this course occur in proper sequence within the School's educational program?  If not, where should it occur?
comments: Since it's an elective, this course is helpful for whoever that wish to take it.

narratives.question_text: Comment on the body of material presented and the content of the course: sequence, syllabus, and assignments.
comments: It's a good course and the syllabus really focus on that certain period of time that Modern Japanese architecture started. Assignments are in mild amount.
The course was very well organized and covered a lot of information. The assignments were appropriate to the course (meaning it was an introductory course) and followed the structure of the class.

narratives.question_text: What were your expectations for this course and how well were they met?
comments: My expectations are just what the syllabus talked about and they met pretty well.

Honestly, I took this course because I wanted to become more familiar with the history of modern Japanese architecture and the current trends in Japan. So in this respect, this course completely fulfilled my expectations.

narratives.question_text: Comment on the value of this course to you.
comments: It helped me to know about that certain part of history and its background.
Considering that I had had a very superficial knowledge of Japanese architecture, this course was very valuable to me.

I enjoyed this course very much. I appreciated that the course structure was cohesive, the material coverage was comprehensive, and the course discussions went beyond the usual anecdotal facts and touched on the philosophical disparities between architectural practice in the east and west. My experience in this course did not only satisfy my initial interest in Japanese architecture, it also helped strengthen and mature my own philosophical views on architecture.

narratives.question_text: Comment on the effectiveness of the teaching by the courses's instructor
comments: Professor Ota and the TA are effective responsible and helpful.

The visual presentation of the material and the accompanied narration were quite successful. Sometimes I found myself lost in the amount of information and would wish to spend more time on individual architects and their work. But considering the nature of the course and its length, perhaps it was not possible to cover all of the information in a grater detail.

Professor Ota is very knowledgeable of the subjects and very well spoken in class. It is sometimes difficult to follow the spelling of Japanese names of buildings and architects. It would be better if handouts were made available at the beginning of each class.

narratives.question_text: Suggestions you may have for course improvements:
comments: Maybe more interactions between instructor and students during the class will be helpful.
